messages.subject: Re: Females & Money
messages.msgSnippet: I got side tracked reading the below  article sent to the list and checked out all the sites on S.P.O.T.  I had viewed the Keepers http://www.Keeper.com  home
messages.messageBody:
I got side tracked reading the below article sent to the list and
checked out all the sites on S.P.O.T. I had viewed the Keepers
http://www.Keeper.com home page a couple of weeks ago, but I'm still
not sure about it. I did run off from Many Moons Alternatives How to
make your own washable cotton pads instructions.
http://www.pacificcoast.net/~manymoons/howto.html I can only wear those
disposable pads for so long and they drive me nuts and make me itch, but
I endure them the length of my cycle. Therefore, I have been looking
for alternatives and the below article exposed me to some other links to
help me in my quest. Thank you to who ever sent it!
Robin
<<SALON | Nov. 30, 1998
http://www.salon.com/mwt/feature/1998/11/30feature2.html>>

$~~~~~~~~~~<O~~****~~O>~~~~~~~~~~$
Robin's Nest http://www.myfreeoffice.com/leuenberger/index.html
$~~~~~~~~~~<O~~****~~O>~~~~~~~~~~$

http://www.myfreeoffice.com/leuenberger/prayers.html

messages.subject: Females & Money
messages.msgSnippet: This article is about menstruation, but ended with this lovely quote. (Besides all the women on this list, there must be many of you with teenage daughters.)
messages.messageBody:
This article is about menstruation, but ended with this lovely quote.
(Besides all the women on this list, there must be many of you with
teenage daughters.)
Mary Ellen
Seek joy in what you give, not in what you get.

But Chambers says she's not bothered by lack of interest. "I'm not really
in it for the money," she says of her business selling the Keeper. "Why
does everything have to be about money? Sure it's nice to make a profit,
but where are people's consciences?"
SALON | Nov. 30, 1998
http://www.salon.com/mwt/feature/1998/11/30feature2.html
